com.github.dm.jrt.stream.transform

Class Transformations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.stream.transform.Transformations

  • public class Transformations
extends Object
    Utility class providing several transformation functions to be applied to a routine stream.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 07/06/2016.

    • Method Summary

      Returns a function making the stream throttle the invocation instances so that only the specified maximum number are concurrently running at any given time.

      Returns a function making the stream throttle the invocation instances so that only the specified maximum number are started in the passed time range.

      Returns a function concatenating to the stream an action always performed when outputs complete, even if an error occurred.

        Returns a function adding a delay at the end of the stream, so that any data, exception or completion notification will be dispatched to the next concatenated routine after the specified time.

        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay value.
        timeUnit - the delay time unit.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified delay is negative.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • parallel

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT,AFTER> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,AFTER>> parallel(int groupCount,
                                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                                       InvocationFactory<? super OUT,? extends AFTER> factory)
        Returns a function splitting the outputs produced by the stream, so that each group will be processed by a different routine invocation.
        Each output will be assigned to a specific group based on the load of the available invocations.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        AFTER - the new output type.
        Parameters:
        groupCount - the number of groups.
        factory - the invocation factory.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified count number is 0 or negative.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • retry

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> retry(int maxCount,
                                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                                            Backoff backoff)
        Returns a function making the stream retry the whole flow of data at maximum for the specified number of times.
        For each retry the specified backoff policy will be applied before re-starting the flow.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        maxCount - the maximum number of retries.
        backoff - the backoff policy.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified count number is 0 or negative.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • retry

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> retry(@NotNull
                                                                                            BiFunction<? super Integer,? super RoutineException,? extends Long> backoffFunction)
        Returns a function making the stream retry the whole flow of data until the specified function does not return a null value.
        For each retry the function is called passing the retry count (starting from 1) and the error which caused the failure. If the function returns a non-null value, it will represent the number of milliseconds to wait before a further retry. While, in case the function returns null, the flow of data will be aborted with the passed error as reason.

        Note that no retry will be attempted in case of an explicit abortion, that is, if the error is an instance of AbortException.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        backoffFunction - the retry function.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • throttle

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> throttle(int maxInvocations)
        Returns a function making the stream throttle the invocation instances so that only the specified maximum number are concurrently running at any given time.
        Note that the same function instance can be used with several streams, so that the total number of invocations will not exceed the specified limit.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        maxInvocations - the maximum number of invocations.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • throttle

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> throttle(int maxInvocations,
                                                                                               @NotNull
                                                                                               DurationMeasure range)
        Returns a function making the stream throttle the invocation instances so that only the specified maximum number are started in the passed time range.
        Note that the same function instance can be used with several streams, so that the total number of started invocations will not exceed the specified limit.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        maxInvocations - the maximum number of invocations.
        range - the time range.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> throttle(int maxInvocations,
                                                                                               long range,
                                                                                               @NotNull
                                                                                               TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Returns a function making the stream throttle the invocation instances so that only the specified maximum number are started in the passed time range.
        Note that the same function instance can be used with several streams, so that the total number of started invocations will not exceed the specified limit.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        maxInvocations - the maximum number.
        range - the time range value.
        timeUnit - the time range unit.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • timeoutAfter

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> timeoutAfter(@NotNull
                                                                                                   DurationMeasure timeout)
        Returns a function making the stream abort with a ResultTimeoutException if a new result is not produced before the specified timeout elapses.
        Note that the execution will not be aborted if no output is produced.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> tryCatch(@NotNull
                                                                                               Function<? super RoutineException,? extends OUT> catchFunction)
        Returns a function concatenating to the stream a consumer handling invocation exceptions.
        The errors will not be automatically further propagated.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        catchFunction - the function instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.

      • tryCatchAccept

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> tryCatchAccept(@NotNull
                                                                                                     BiConsumer<? super RoutineException,? super Channel<OUT,?>> catchConsumer)
        Returns a function concatenating to the stream a consumer handling invocation exceptions.
        The result channel of the backing routine will be passed to the consumer, so that multiple or no results may be generated.
        The errors will not be automatically further propagated.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        catchConsumer - the bi-consumer instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)

      • tryFinally

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> tryFinally(@NotNull
                                                                                                 Action finallyAction)
        Returns a function concatenating to the stream an action always performed when outputs complete, even if an error occurred.
        Both outputs and errors will be automatically passed on.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        finallyAction - the action instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        See Also:
        StreamBuilder.with(Function)
